name: Floodplain Engagement Frequency (bankfull recurrence)
functionStatement: Peak flows reshape channel without chronic instability, redistribute wood and sediment, reset habitats, and supply nutrients to floodplains.
descriptionMarkdown: Moderate floods (~1-2 yr) overtop banks unless valley is naturally confined.
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Floodplain and Channel

Method: Desktop
howToMeasureMarkdown: Relate bankfull stage to flood-frequency analysis to estimate recurrence of floodplain engagement. Use gage analysis where available or regional regressions as a screening proxy.

inputs.label: Floodplain Engagement Frequency (bankfull recurrence)
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: About 1-2 yr floods engage the floodplain. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: About 3-5 yr floods are needed. / About 5-10 yr floods are needed. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Floodplain is rarely inundated except during extreme events. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)
